channel.title: Posts on WHISTLER.PAGE
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on WHISTLER.PAGE

item.title: NEW! v0.1.3 is now available!
item.description: What’s this, now? I finally finished getting back into the swing of things, and build v0.1.3 is available to read now! More to follow obviously (v0.1.4 is next), but I’m starting to get on a roll! [ READ RCP ]

item.title: Systemware Monthly Progress Report
item.description: Header The time: 3:27 PM Eastern Time The place: Systemware Internal Product Testing Lab 3 The writer: Jay Isles Summary This is the first of a monthly internal progress report used for tracking the movements of the sapient AI, Whistler. During the course of the month, Whistler has not moved in much, if any, capacity. The only occurance to have happened within the month is a single update to its so-called “pet project”, Dreamsearch.

item.title: A Minor Update
Returning from the Crypt of the Past...
item.description: What are you doing now? I just put up an old story I made ages ago, or more specifically two parts of. RCP is something I intend to make into a bit of a horror story, but progress is somewhat slow! I’d know, since it stalled for a year, but now I’m working on it again. I’ve wanted to pull it out of the freezer for a while now, but my past self just had to generate it with Microsoft Word.

item.title: The Modern Internet
item.description: First instance of me using this site as a bit of a blog, yay. Why not use Twitter? Reddit? Literally anything else? Oh boy, strap in.

item.title: Dreamsearch Announcement
item.description: Dreamsearch If you are receiving this message, please do not panic. You are asleep, and everything is working normally. This pre-written message will help you get situated with the Dreamsearch project. You may be wondering why you cannot see. This is normal. Due to the limitations of $CURRENT_TECHNOLOGY, visuals and auditory information cannot be generated. To counteract this, Systemware(R) has created the Systemware Intelligent System Software, or SWISS, to assist you.

item.title: Happy birthday, Penny!
item.description: This was a terrible post celebrating a friend’s birthday. I wiped it because it was terrible. I left the page here so the funny QR code still works.
